column3: Definition
AL IAO:0000115@en
A measurement datum defining the aspect of an anatomical entity on which an observation is made.
column4: Phaleron Paleopathology Scoring Key, version 17 September 2021, p.1.

column3: A measurement datum approximating how much of a skeletal element or specific portion of an element is affected by an observed condition.
column4: Phaleron Paleopathology Scoring Key, version 17 September 2021, p.1/2.

column3: A measurement datum defining in which part of a bone organ new bone formation is observed.
column4: Phaleron Paleopathology Scoring Key, version 17 September 2021, p.2.

column3: A measurement datum describing characteristics of newly added bone.
column4: Phaleron Paleopathology Scoring Key, version 17 September 2021, p.3.

column3: A measurement datum describing the appearance of the endosteal surface where reactive bone formation narrows the medullary cavity.
column4: Phaleron Paleopathology Scoring Key, version 17 September 2021, p.3/4.
column5: Buikstra, J. E., & Ubelaker, D. H. (Eds.) (1994). Standards for data collection from human skeletal remains. Fayetteville: Arkansas Archaeological Survey. p.119.

column3: A measurement datum defining whether abnormal matrix formation resulting from immature, woven bone, replacing normal cortical structures is present or not.
column5: Buikstra, J. E., & Ubelaker, D. H. (Eds.) (1994). Standards for data collection from human skeletal remains. Fayetteville: Arkansas Archaeological Survey. p.119.

column3: A measurement datum describing the presence and appearance of perpendicular spicules added to the intact periosteal surface.
column4: Phaleron Paleopathology Scoring Key, version 17 September 2021, p.3.
column5: Buikstra, J. E., & Ubelaker, D. H. (Eds.) (1994). Standards for data collection from human skeletal remains. Fayetteville: Arkansas Archaeological Survey. p.118.

column3: A measurement datum describing characteristics of bone created by processes within the bone organ that have caused perforation of the periosteal surface.
column4: Phaleron Paleopathology Scoring Key, version 17 September 2021, p.3.
column5: Buikstra, J. E., & Ubelaker, D. H. (Eds.) (1994). Standards for data collection from human skeletal remains. Fayetteville: Arkansas Archaeological Survey. p.118.

column3: A measurement datum defining whether myositis ossificans is present or not.
column5: Buikstra, J. E., & Ubelaker, D. H. (Eds.) (1994). Standards for data collection from human skeletal remains. Fayetteville: Arkansas Archaeological Survey. p.119.

column3: A measurement datum defining the aspect of a bone on which myositis ossificans is observed.
A measurement datum approximating how much of a skeletal element or specific portion of an element is affected by myositis ossificans.
A measurement datum defining whether bone reactions known as stellate scars, or ″caries sicca″, are present or not.
column5: Buikstra, J. E., & Ubelaker, D. H. (Eds.) (1994). Standards for data collection from human skeletal remains. Fayetteville: Arkansas Archaeological Survey. p.119.

column3: A measurement datum defining the aspect of a bone on which stellate scars are observed.
A measurement datum approximating how much of a skeletal element or specific portion of an element is affected by stellate scars.
A measurement datum defining whether a sequestrum is present or not.
column5: Buikstra, J. E., & Ubelaker, D. H. (Eds.) (1994). Standards for data collection from human skeletal remains. Fayetteville: Arkansas Archaeological Survey. p.119, fig.101.

column3: A measurement datum defining the aspect of a bone on which a sequestrum is observed.
A measurement datum approximating how much of a skeletal element or specific portion of an element is affected by a sequestrum.
A measurement datum defining whether an involucrum is present or not.
column5: Buikstra, J. E., & Ubelaker, D. H. (Eds.) (1994). Standards for data collection from human skeletal remains. Fayetteville: Arkansas Archaeological Survey. p.119, fig.101.

column3: A measurement datum defining the aspect of a bone on which an involucrum is observed.
A measurement datum approximating how much of a skeletal element or specific portion of an element is affected by an involucrum.
